column2: 1984MIDI INTERFACES FOR THE IBM PC, Electronic Musician, September 1990David Trubitt (1993), Making Music with Your Computer, page 22

column1: Special CCSpecial CCs are CCs that don't correspond to the parameter of any particular effect. Most usually they represent special one-shot control commands for the device (these ones are usually represented by a button on a console), or used internally for bank selection, RPN or data entry, etc.

Parametric effect CCParametric CCs (also known as continuous controller) correspond to the parameter of some particular effect (i.e. depth, strength, delay of effect, etc). Such CCs are usually represented by a rotating knob or fader in mixers.
